sen.j: 近衛家久（このえいえひさ 貞享4年5月8日 (旧暦)（1687年6月17日） - 元文2年8月17日 (旧暦)（1737年9月11日））は、江戸時代中期の公家・公卿、関白、太政大臣。
sen.e: Iehisa KONOE (June 17, 1687-September 11, 1737) was a Court noble, peer and official of the highest rank, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), and Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in the mid-Edo period.

Iehisa KONOE (June 17, 1687-September 11, 1737) was a Court noble, peer and official of the highest rank, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), and Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in the mid-Edo period.

Iehisa KONOE (June 17, 1687-September 11, 1737) was a Court noble, peer and official of the highest rank, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), and Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) in the mid-Edo period.
His father was Iehiro KONOE.
His father was Iehiro KONOE.
His father was Iehiro KONOE.

sen.j: 母は霊元天皇第二皇女の憲子内親王 (霊元天皇皇女)。
sen.e: His mother was Imperial Princess Noriko, the second daughter of Emperor Reigen.
His mother was Imperial Princess Noriko, the second daughter of Emperor Reigen.
sen.cmt: was の後のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: His mother was Imperial Princess Noriko, the second daughter of Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: 伯母に近衛熙子（6代将軍徳川家宣室）。
sen.e: His aunt was Hiroko KONOE (the consort of the sixth Shogun Ienobu TOKUGAWA).
His aunt was Hiroko KONOE (the consort of the sixth Shogun Ienobu TOKUGAWA).
His aunt was Hiroko KONOE (the consort of the sixth Shogun Ienobu TOKUGAWA).

sen.j: 正室は島津綱貴の娘・亀姫、継室は島津吉貴の娘・満君。
sen.e: His consort was Kamehime, the daughter of Tsunataka SHIMAZU, and his second wife was Man-kimi (the daughter of Yoshitaka SHIMAZU.
His consort was Kamehime, the daughter of Tsunataka SHIMAZU, and his second wife was Man-kimi (the daughter of Yoshitaka SHIMAZU.
His consort was Kamehime, the daughter of Tsunataka SHIMAZU, and his second wife was Man-kimi (the daughter of Yoshitaka SHIMAZU.

sen.j: 子に近衛内前、転陵院（尾張藩第9代藩主徳川宗睦正室）など。
sen.e: Uchisaki KONOE and Tenryoin (the consort of Munechika TOKUGAWA, the ninth lord of the Owari Domain) numbered among his children.
Uchisaki KONOE and Tenryoin (the consort of Munechika TOKUGAWA, the ninth lord of the Owari Domain) numbered among his children.
Uchisaki KONOE and Tenryoin (the consort of Munechika TOKUGAWA, the ninth lord of the Owari Domain) numbered among his children.
He was appointed as Kanpaku in 1726.
He was appointed as Kanpaku in 1726.
He was appointed as Kanpaku in 1726.

sen.j: 「家久公記」という日記がある。
sen.e: He authored the diary called "Records of Iehisa."
He authored the diary called "Records of Iehisa."
He authored the diary called "Records of Iehisa."
